start.text: You see a boy sitting alone in an empty classroom. His name is Elliot. He looks up at you, confused. 'Do I... know you?'

memory_flicker.text: Elliot tilts his head. 'That’s strange... I don’t remember meeting you. But I feel like I should.' His fingers tap nervously on the desk. 'Do you remember my brother?'

elliot_reacts.text: Elliot nods slowly. 'I think I want to know me too.' His voice wavers. 'I had a brother, you know. Always there for me. Always...' He stops. 'Wait. That’s not right.' The room flickers. The walls change color. 'Who are you?'

glitch_twin.text: The lights dim. The words on the blackboard shift into unreadable symbols. Elliot grips his head. 'He was real. He was real. He was—' His voice distorts. A shadow appears behind him, mirroring his movements. 'You see him, don’t you?'

elliot_denial.text: Elliot laughs, but his eyes dart around the room. 'That’s funny. You almost sound like them. The others. They say the same thing. That he wasn’t real. But he was. I remember him.' His expression darkens. 'Unless... they made me forget?'

trust_question.text: Elliot leans in. 'Do you trust me?' The classroom seems to stretch, the walls pulling away into darkness. His eyes flicker between fear and something unreadable.

new_conspiracy.text: Elliot’s expression shifts from fear to realization. 'Wait... you’re lying.' The room distorts. Faint voices whisper from nowhere. 'They erased him. They erased HIM.' His breathing quickens. 'And they’ll erase you too if you keep asking.'

conspiracy_deepens.text: The fluorescent lights above flicker violently. A faint sound, like distant footsteps, echoes through the hall. Elliot grips your wrist. 'Listen to me. He was taken. Not by time. Not by memory. By THEM. The teachers. The students. Everyone plays along.'

truth_revealed.text: A door creaks open behind Elliot. Inside, endless monitors show footage of him—alone. Talking to himself. Every conversation he remembers... is just him. But there’s another screen. A blurry figure, face censored, being dragged away. 'No... No, that’s not...' His voice breaks. The screen flickers. The experiment logs update. 'Subject Elliot—progressing as expected.'

distortion_warning.text: The screen glitches. A distorted voice crackles: 'You were never supposed to remember.' The air vibrates with an unnatural hum. Elliot looks at you, terrified. 'It’s watching us.'

cliffhanger.text: The room collapses into static. Elliot’s voice echoes: 'It’s too late. They’re here.' The screen flashes white. Everything stops.
